result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle J. Orlowski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:40 a.m. Defendant Kyle J. Orlowski in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CF482, 15CT307, 15CT313, 16CF23, 15TR2948, and to be dismissed and read in 16CF53, 16CM24, 16CM25, 15TR2947, 15TR3411, 15TR3412, 15TR3442, 15TR3443, 15TR3444. (16CF23 count 6 was amended to 5)
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF482 Count 1: No Contest
15CF482 Count 4: No Contest
15CT307: No Contest
15CT313: No Contest
16CF23 Count 1: No Contest
16CF23 Count 5: No Contest
15TR2948: No Contest
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  15CF482 Count 1, 15CF482 Count 4, 15CT307-2nd, 15CT313-3rd, 16CF23 Count 1, 16CF23 Count 5, 15TR2948.
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed and read in 15CF482 Count 2, & 3, 16CF23 Count 2, 3, & 4, 16CF53, 16CM24, 16CM25, 15TR2947, 15TR3411, 15TR3412, 15TR3442, 15TR3443, and 15TR3444.
ADA Cousins states this is a joint recommendation. 
Atty Sheets concurs. 
Defendant makes statements to the court.

BY THE COURT:***PROBATION****
15CF482 Count 1: 
I/S Sentence 1 yr Jail, concurrent - stayed 
24 mo Probation, concurrent 
Comply with same conditions as stated in in 16CF23.
Pay costs & DNA surcharges.

15CF482 Count 4: I/S Sentence 6 mo Jail, concurrent--if revoke at the same time; otherwise, it would be consecutive - stayed
12 months probation, concurrent
Conditions:
Comply with same conditions as stated in 16CF23 and Count 1.
Pay costs and DNA surcharges.

16CF23 Count 1:
I/S Sentence 1 yr Jail - stayed
24 months probation
Conditions:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.  
Get GED & Driver's License.
Comply with any other assessments and/or counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent.
Submit DNA sample, if didn't do so already.
Pay costs & DNA sucharges. 
-------
16CF23 Count 5: Straight Jail sentence
60 days jail, 1/2 in jail and balance on electronic monitor, with huber, Report today for start date. To be served within 60 days.
Jail credit to be stipulated and submit to the court at a later date.
Pay costs & DNA surcharges. Pay w/in 60 days or set up payment plan.

15CT307 Op w/o Valid 2nd: Pay costs w/in 60 days or set up payment plan.
15CT313 Op w/o Valid 3rd: Pay costs w/in 60 days or set up payment plan.
15TR2948 Seatbelt: $10.00 fine. Pay w/in 60 days or set up payment plan.
Defendant's Motion for Discovery and Inspection filed by Atty Eric Sheets
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on May 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kyle J. Orlowski in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant indicates he already has an attorney, Eric Sheets.
Atty Cousins makes statements re: setting the matter for status conference. 

Court questions the defendant re: waiver of preliminary hearing time limits. 
Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held. 

State recommends a $500 signature bond.  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.
